    All Classes and Interfaces

    Classes
    Class
    Description
    Animation
    The Animation class represents a simple frame-based animation system for cycling through an array of images at a specified delay.
    BestTimesScreen
     
    Collectible
    Represents a collectible item in the game world.
    CollisionHandler
    Handles collision events in the game world.
    ControlsPanel
    The ControlsPanel class displays the game controls as an attractive, modern overlay panel.
    DropUpControlPanel
    A panel that displays a drop‑up button in the bottom‑left corner.
    Enemy
    Represents an enemy character that moves back and forth and animates accordingly.
    Flag
    Represents the level completion flag in the game.
    FlyingEnemy
    Represents a flying enemy that extends the behavior of a regular enemy by adding vertical movement.
    FontManager
    The FontManager class is responsible for loading and managing custom fonts for the game.
    Game
    The main class that manages the game lifecycle, including world creation, view rendering, input handling, pause/menu interaction, and game loop timing.
    GameCompleteScreen
    The screen shown when all levels are completed.
    GameOverScreen
    Represents the Game Over screen shown when the player loses.
    GameState
    A serializable class that encapsulates the complete state of a game session.
    GameView
    The GameView class represents the main visual rendering component of the game.
    GameWorld
    Represents the game world, including the player, levels, and game mechanics.
    HighScoreManager
    Manages persistence of the top three (lowest) completion times across sessions.
    Level
    Abstract base class for a game level.
    Level1
    Represents Level 1 of the game.
    Level2
    Represents Level 2 of the game.
    Level3
    Represents Level 3 of the game.
    Level4
    Represents Level 4 of the game.
    LevelCompleteScreen
    Represents the Level Complete screen shown when a player finishes a level.
    Obstacle
    Represents a vibrating obstacle in the game.
    PauseOverlayPanel
    A semi-transparent overlay panel used for pausing the game.
    Platform
    Represents a static platform in the game world that players can stand or jump on.
    Player
    Represents the player character in the game, handling movement and animations.
    PlayerController
    Handles keyboard input for controlling the Player character.
    PolygonEditor
    Very basic polygon editor.
    SoundManager
    Manages game audio using the SoundClip class.
    StartupScreen
    The main entry point and title screen for the 2D platformer game.
